c8a8ad3a-672a-47ce-b49a-67b12461b225: A beast rider is proficient with light and medium armor, and with shields (with the exception of tower shields).
3be3b57a-9e22-4c5f-a877-03d0b8f1d8fc: A cavalier who belongs to this order has pledged himself to a sovereign; be it a king, queen, or even the local warlord. Cavaliers of this order are stalwart and dedicated to their cause, willing to go any length to ensure the safety of their lord and his domain.
12ca7dc6-2e49-48a6-92be-1e62e478d8bf: A cavalier who belongs to this order serves only himself, working to further his own aims and increase his own prestige. Cavaliers of this order tend to be selfish and concerned only with personal goals and objectives.
0787cfe8-d75c-49a6-82f1-d4b78e1a5bf3:
A deity, also known as a god or goddess, is a being or force of incredible power capable of granting its power to mortal beings through divine magic. A deity is strongly associated with a specific {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, several domains, and a plane.
Each deity also limits the choice of your starting alignment and the choices for certain classes. Deity choice cannot be changed later.
434ba4aa-f220-4caa-a12b-a1af37f8f5b1: A disciple of the pike gains a +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against creatures larger than he is. This bonus increases by 1 if the creature is two {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} categories larger. At 6th level, the bonus increases to +3 against a creature three size categories larger, and at 12th level, the bonus increases to +4 against creatures four size categories larger.
12d5efc2-2e36-4a3b-b927-2517deb80c2c:
A fearsome leader can help his allies throw off effects of enemy fear with his own display.
Each time you use Dazzling Display, you also try to dispel all fear effects on your allies in the same radius, using your cavalier level as {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}.
Starting at 9th level, your allies also gain the benefit of the good hope {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to your {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g}, but no more than once per combat.
efdd1d54-babd-4713-99bc-1084891d3233: A gendarme trains to be a mounted terror, almost to the exclusion of all other abilities. He gains bonus combat or mounted combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} at 1st level, 3rd level, and then every three levels thereafter.
46b96b2f-24da-40d6-bf84-be662e9ff01b: An order of the lion cavalier adds {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_World}Knowledge (world){/g} to his list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
40b7c447-f6e9-4934-a448-04f4f0978992: An order of the shroud cavalier adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} to his list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
d0423859-9222-4966-9e3a-32eaf3d2d5eb: An order of the star cavalier adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} to his list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
1d629ff5-6d06-45db-8a40-03e52ca524f9: An order of the sword cavalier adds {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Religion}Lore (religion){/g} to his list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
0588cc92-1e0e-4b8b-82d8-97f9cfbe960d: At 11th level, a cavalier learns to make devastating charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} while mounted. Double the threat range of any weapons wielded during a charge while mounted. This increase does not stack with other effects that increase the threat range of the weapon. In addition, the cavalier can make a free bull rush and trip {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} if his charge attack is successful. These free combat maneuvers do not provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}.
a7fdc690-0e09-4286-8608-b12d446223f4: At 11th level, a disciple of the pike takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalties{/g} caused by difficult terrain while charging. His movement is still hampered by obstacles, poor visibility, and other conditions. This ability doesn't allow him to move through impassible terrain.
b7208685-d213-41b3-bbbe-f70d740a97e8: At 11th level, a standard bearer's banner becomes an even more potent symbol of protection and inspiration to those around him. Once per day, while his banner is displayed, the standard bearer can wave it through the air as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, granting all allies within 60 feet temporary {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit points{/g} equal to 1/2 his cavalier level, and a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} while the temporary hit points last. At 15th level, and every four levels thereafter, this bonus increases by +1 (to a maximum of +4 at 19th level). The temporary hit points last for 10 minutes or until depleted, whichever occurs first.
b4c2c51e-4b9c-4dc1-84eb-3ace6f17b4b6: At 12th level, whenever a cavalier declares a challenge, his target must pay attention to the threat he poses. As long as the target is within the {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatened area{/g} of the cavalier, it takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to its {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} from {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made by anyone other than the cavalier.
f5c1325f-2739-43cf-b7db-618b764b8573: At 12th level, whenever a knight of the wall declares a challenge, his target must pay particular attention to him. As long as the target is within the {g|Encyclopedia:Threatened_Area}threatened area{/g} of the cavalier, it takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against anyone other than the knight of the wall.
b6ca9dea-c859-4c45-9ca0-dde2482da927: At 14th level, the cavalier's banner becomes a rallying call to his allies. All allies within 60 feet receive a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against charm and compulsion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and effects.
ee024181-499a-4b82-9603-9485f6313665: At 15th level, an order of the lion cavalier can protect those around him. Allies that are adjacent to the cavalier receive a +3 shield {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to their {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
771b6869-a864-43d2-91f0-b17e44d25b94: At 15th level, the cavalier can make a knight's challenge once per day. This functions like a normal challenge, but the cavalier adds his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} bonus on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of his challenge. In addition, he receives a +4 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on attack rolls made to confirm {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hits{/g} against the target of his knight's challenge.
babffa3a-eb38-47e8-b5a7-19503af66f83: At 15th level, the cavalier can take retribution on those who dare to strike an agent of his faith. Whenever an enemy makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} against the cavalier or an adjacent ally devoted to the same faith as the cavalier, the enemy provokes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} from the cavalier. The cavalier receives a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} of opportunity. If the attack made by the enemy was a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, the cavalier may treat the enemy as the target of his challenge for the attack of opportunity. The cavalier can use this ability once per {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
f510068c-503b-499e-9b11-e18f1ac89a74: At 15th level, the cavalier can take revenge on undead that dare strike him or those he seeks to protect. Whenever an undead creature that is the subject of his challenge hits the cavalier or an adjacent ally with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, the creature provokes an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} from the cavalier. The cavalier gains a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} of opportunity provoked as a result of this ability. If an undead subject of the cavalier's challenge threatens a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against the cavalier, the cavalier gains a deflection bonus equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier against the confirmation {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}. This bonus functions as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural ability{/g}.
bebdf9bd-5b75-45a6-97a5-219ab45aea96: At 15th level, the cavalier can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}, declare a moment of triumph. For 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}, the cavalier receives a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier on all {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. This bonus is also added to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. In addition, any critical threats he makes are automatically confirmed. The cavalier can use this ability once per day.
a90dbedf-8377-479a-a455-87d0c5e0268a: At 15th level, when the cavalier hits the target of his challenge with a {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g}, and that target is at least Large {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g}, he gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} equal to half his cavalier level. This damage is multiplied on a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}.
aca4033f-ce3c-4d6b-9ca5-b6ee7b9dd3d5: At 1st level, a cavalier must pledge himself to a specific order. The order grants the cavalier a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g}, class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g}.
0bcaa198-9090-4c08-a844-44174025cdd7: At 1st level, a cavalier receives a teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the cavalier can grant his teamwork feat to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear him. Allies retain the use of this bonus feat for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round for every two levels the cavalier possesses. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of these bonus feats. The cavalier can use this ability once per day at 1st level, plus one additional time per day at 5th level and for every 5 levels thereafter.
e7226694-0337-4e69-9b77-ffc9cce18fcd: At 20th level, a gendarme represents the epitome of mounted combat. Whenever he makes a charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} while mounted, he deals triple the normal {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. In addition, if the gendarme confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} on a charge attack while mounted, the attack deals additional damage equal to his weapon damage. Additional damage from weapon properties, magic effects, precision-based {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonuses{/g}, or other increases are {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}rolled{/g} normally.
216bac92-c301-4845-99d8-b9b96c86af3a: At 20th level, a standard bearer's banner has become a powerful rallying point to his allies, and a bane to his foes. Whenever his banner is visible, allies of the standard bearer within 60 feet gain a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, immunity to fear effects, and a +3 morale bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against mind-affecting effects.
bcd4a4ac-ed06-4997-acdd-0c266b643531: At 20th level, whenever a disciple of the pike makes a charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a polearm or spear, he deals double the normal amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. In addition, if he confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} on a deadly charge, the target is stunned for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. If the target succeeds at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + the cavalier's {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}), it is instead staggered for 1d4 rounds.
b698e8e1-98fe-40b7-84e1-451b0bdb3f00: At 20th level, whenever the cavalier makes a charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} while mounted, he deals double the normal amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (or triple if using shortspear, spear or longspear or with spirited charge or quadruple if both). In addition, if the cavalier confirms a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} on a charge attack while mounted, the target is stunned for {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g}. A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces this to staggered for 1d4 rounds. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} is equal to 10 + the cavalier's {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g}.
4eb0aadf-ff90-4d06-ac3e-b858da1b2fd1: At 2nd level, an order of the lion cavalier gains the ability to rally his allies. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can give an encouraging speech which grants all allies within 60 feet a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on their {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier and a +1 competence bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to his cavalier level. Any time when ally under effect should make saving throw against frightened or panicked, he may make two saving throws to avoid the effect (if a saving throw is allowed), taking the better of the two results as his actual saving throw.
bb1bb0de-457e-47b5-a7ba-4cd54918aa1e: At 2nd level, the cavalier can call upon the spirits of the fallen for protection. The cavalier gains a a +1 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} when {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacked{/g} by an undead target of his challenge. The bonus increases by 1 for every 4 class levels the cavalier possesses.
16ec2bdc-8e3a-4d6c-ba3f-c9a8cb6de076:
At 2nd level, the cavalier can make a short prayer as a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}, filling him with confidence in his abilities. At any point in the next minute, he can receive a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier on his next {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g}. He can use this ability up to four times per day.
In addition, the cavalier adds half his cavalier level to any levels of paladin or cleric he might possess for the purposes of determining the effects of channel energy or lay on hands.
0b98229c-429d-4f1b-bf6a-eaf3d5bc24c5: At 2nd level, the cavalier can ready his allies for impending danger. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, he can ready all allies within 30 feet of the danger ahead, granting a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}. At any point in the next minute, when these allies fail a saving throw, they {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}reroll{/g} the saving throw with a +4 competence bonus as an immediate {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}action{/g}, but must take the results of the reroll even if it is worse. He can use this ability up to three times per day.
edcc145f-84ea-487d-937e-9bdf73753b9d: At 2nd level, the cavalier must select one {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}. As long as he maintains the selected alignment, he receives a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to one {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} of his choice.
1b850040-80c6-4bbd-b74a-bbdd03fcac0e: At 2nd level, the cavalier receives Dazzling Display as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. The cavalier receives a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls made against targets under fear effects.
6397c75c-b211-4c26-be2d-7a888918827f: At 3rd level, a cavalier learns to make more accurate charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} while mounted. The cavalier receives a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls on a charge while mounted (instead of the normal +2). In addition, the cavalier does not suffer any {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} after making a charge attack while mounted.
2cdfda23-a2b1-46be-8a1d-43c4ba5a5778: At 3rd level, a disciple of the pike learns to make more accurate charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} with weapons from the polearms or spears fighter weapon group. He receives a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} when charging with a polearm or spear (instead of the normal +2). In addition, the disciple of the pike takes no {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} after making a charge attack with a polearm or spear.
ec34c2c5-ad6a-41a7-aa30-d896d098431f: At 3rd level, a fearsome leader gains a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g} made to intimidate, increasing by +1 for every three levels thereafter.
ed56d52a-438a-4407-8be3-9320fdf8b6f8: At 4th level, a disciple of the pike has an uncanny ability to identify monsters. He gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to half of his cavalier level on {g|Encyclopedia:Knowledge_Arcana}Knowledge (arcana){/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature) checks{/g}.
0848a0f7-ee69-4dcd-b717-56c7c9ad9fee: At 4th level, a knight of the wall specializes in using his shield to deflect {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. He adds a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his shield bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Touch_AC}touch AC{/g} and his {g|Encyclopedia:CMD}CMD{/g}. He does not include any enhancement bonus he has from a magic shield in this calculation.
0e2eee2a-97f3-42d1-97cb-037b13dfff9f: At 5th level, a cavalier's banner becomes a symbol of inspiration to his allies and companions. As long as the cavalier's banner is clearly visible, all allies within 60 feet receive a +2 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against fear and a +1 morale bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} made as part of a charge. At 10th level, and every five levels thereafter, these bonuses increase by +1.
6064c5d3-f5c2-4740-b065-59749777d76a: At 6th level, and at every six levels thereafter, a cavalier gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as combat feats. The cavalier must meet the prerequisites of these bonus feats.
36b6bdb0-7893-4494-b106-2a004f0dfe64: At 8th level, an order of the lion cavalier can call out to his allies, inspiring them to greatness. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the cavalier can grant a competence {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier on all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} to all allies within 30 feet. This bonus lasts for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. This ability can be used once per combat.
86a3cf24-436d-4c58-8287-b83847b2c26b: At 8th level, the cavalier can call upon his faith to bolster himself in combat. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Free_Action}free action{/g}, the cavalier can call out the name of his deity, granting him a morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. In addition, any allies within 30 feet that share his faith also receive half this bonus (minimum +1). The cavalier can use this ability once per day, plus one additional time per day at 12th level and every four levels thereafter.
8589ff36-94ea-499f-bad7-b6920974b580: At 8th level, the cavalier can steal the glory from another creature's successful strike. Whenever a creature other than the cavalier scores a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g} against a target that the cavalier is threatening, he can make an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} against the same target.
bc7dd707-98bf-4b94-bc43-53a9e251e82e: At 8th level, the cavalier's weapons are treated as having the cavalier's {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} for the purpose of overcoming the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} of undead creatures. Against an undead target of his challenge, the cavalier automatically overcomes all {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction that undead possesses.
9432a22b-49c1-47fc-9055-c5a51d35c9dd: At 8th level, when the cavalier uses his wolf or dog mount to perform a bull rush or overrun {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}maneuver{/g}, the mount gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on the combat maneuver. He also receives a bonus mounted combat {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}
eea24898-732d-490c-ab8e-676ec2663746: At 8th level, whenever the cavalier makes a charge {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} while mounted, he adds his mount's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage roll{/g}, in addition to his own. He also receives a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, chosen from the following list: Indomitable Mount, Mounted Combat, Mounted Shield, Spirited Charge, or Trample. He must qualify for the feat selected.
e16d576b-743d-4866-808c-e7055dead3d0: At 9th level, the cavalier receives an additional teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. Using the tactician ability is a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
dbec045f-f7e7-418a-bd53-49abb295a519: At 9th level, when carrying a shield, a knight of the wall adds a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} equal to his shield bonus to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} on Will {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. He does not include any enhancement bonus from a magic shield in this calculation.
9dbb83de-e544-48d3-8b61-e0c93d67b748: Cavalier is a warrior who has an animal companion — a faithful steed they can ride into battle. They are strong melee fighters who can also empower their allies.
5a7cdc85-b560-46e1-98a6-ab1bf5275885: Cavaliers are proficient with all simple and {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}martial weapons{/g}, with all types of armor (heavy, light, and medium) and with shields (except tower shields).
1d5248a7-46bb-4929-8cb6-5da810e5941c: Cavaliers of the Order of the Paw pledge to defend halflings, halfling settlements, and other innocent folks by patrolling the wilderness and seeking out possible threats to both individuals and whole communities. These cavaliers hunt down potential danger with a ruthless efficiency and determination that non-halflings find surprising and even somewhat alarming.
5cc04d45-9e08-4e8d-9ed0-b37e213bd6b2: Cavaliers of this order seek out and destroy undead and those who harbor or create them. They scour old crypts, graveyards, and battlefields to bring eternal rest.
6c9cdcc8-ff12-4220-a197-cbfd537db9c0: Cavaliers who join the order of the star dedicate themselves to the protection and service of a faith and its members. Cavaliers belonging to this order tend to follow many of the tenets and guides of the religion that they serve.
52e6a877-efca-489c-8cd0-e86924c639db: Cavaliers who join the order of the sword dedicate their lives to the code of chivalry, living a life of honor, valor, and fairness. Cavaliers of this order tend to swear service to a lord or a lady. Of all the orders, the order of the sword is perhaps the broadest in terms of its focus and ideals.
71cfd93a-b85b-4c2c-8b3a-c645b2b661d8: Each cavalier chooses an order to join. Their order gives them ability to challenge an enemy, gaining advantages against them. Each order gives the challenge its own unique advantages. It also gives the cavalier additional abilities as they advance.
4af67f59-8bde-4277-a9eb-53352f85cfbd: Fear is a good motivator — and some commanders use this fact to inspire their troops, preferring it to the usual approach.
928bea64-fdf4-481a-9611-3bc16bfd048b: Not all cavaliers are content to ride at the head of a charge, leading from the front and facing down their enemies directly. Some prefer to stand away from the fray, their banners a beacon shining brightly over the battlefield, rallying their troops to victory. The standard bearer employs the banner of his order, his lord, or his own house to raise the spirits of his allies and warns enemies of impending doom.
0313eac3-3aeb-4ba6-a517-6e36f8791b68:
Once per day, a cavalier can challenge a foe to combat. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the cavalier chooses one target within sight to challenge. The cavalier's {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attacks{/g} deal extra {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} whenever the {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} are made against the target of his challenge. This extra damage is equal to the cavalier's level. The cavalier can use this ability once per day at 1st level, plus one additional time per day for every three levels beyond 1st, to a maximum of seven times per day at 19th level.
Challenging a foe requires much of the cavalier's {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration{/g}. The cavalier takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}, except against attacks made by the target of his challenge.
The challenge remains in effect until the target is dead or {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}unconscious{/g} or until the combat ends. Each cavalier's challenge also includes another effect which is listed in the section describing the cavalier's order.
e5cf99fd-e3c5-4059-8420-608930ecceb0: The Order of the Pike are renowned monster hunters, taking on large game using ancient weapon arts combined with modern equipment.
09f53417-5c3a-426a-bc98-2c88e6b3ac9e: The cavalier is defined not only by his dedication to his order or his skill on the battlefield, but also by the special relationship he maintains with his mount. Where some cavaliers are simply skilled with horses or well-trained knights, the beast rider spends his life in constant pursuit of the most perfect mount, forming bonds with greater, more powerful, and more exotic creatures.
e613c1ca-3c2e-486e-8e02-31bc992fa358: The cavaliers known as Knights of the Wall revere a famous general who was crucial in the defeat of a powerful wizard-king.
e78ae7aa-a0cd-4d42-be4d-c67adfd20de4: The character chooses a companion from the list of available animals. Animal companion can wear barding and gains new abilities as they advance.
fafb9502-35c2-48f5-9646-3086ed292130: The character gains bonus command {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} that empower allies who fight side by side if they have the same feats, and gives their effects to all teammates.
59d20b76-ce67-46c0-9b8c-b1d199013291: The gendarme cares less for the finer points of tactical precision than he does for the exhilaration of the charge: the rush of wind through the visor of his helmet, the feel of his couched lance, the satisfying shriek of armor giving way before his weapon's force as the point drives past metal into his foes.
4b7c860f-fee4-4982-a071-c917f7a15a51: When you are adjacent to one or more allies who also have this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}, you gain a +1 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} per such ally (maximum +4).
7027b9a7-1c67-4a2a-a734-d7ffc7470137: Whenever an Order of the Paw cavalier issues a challenge, his mount gains a +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} as long it is threatening the target of the cavalier's challenge and the cavalier is riding the mount. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the cavalier possesses.
3d2c5d82-a177-4d55-8c3e-4a7b5006f3ee: Whenever an order of the cockatrice cavalier issues a challenge, he receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the target of his challenge as long as he is the only creature threatening the target. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the cavalier possesses.
a995ab84-ac8c-44f0-9197-73e5d05ab23d: Whenever an order of the lion cavalier issues a challenge, he receives a +1 dodge {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to his {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g} against {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} made by the target of his challenge. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the cavalier possesses.
c03ef3f2-796b-43ef-8a51-d03892805812: Whenever an order of the shroud cavalier issues a challenge to an undead creature, he receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against the target of his challenge. The bonus increases by 1 for every 4 class levels the cavalier possesses.
edb4c627-fc19-41a5-9aa2-f2866696459e: Whenever an order of the star cavalier issues a challenge, he receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all his {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} as long as he is threatening the target of his challenge. This bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the cavalier possesses.
a4d430b2-6b8b-4c26-a0a4-9a61ae4f1af2: Whenever an order of the sword cavalier issues a challenge, he receives a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against the target of his challenge so long as he is astride his mount. The bonus increases by +1 for every four levels the cavalier possesses.
64bce211-a221-423f-98bd-c002d56166dc: While many warriors strive to perfect their art, spending all of their time honing their skill at martial arms, others spend as much effort dedicating themselves to a cause. These warriors, known as cavaliers, swear themselves to a purpose, serving it above all else. Cavaliers are skilled at fighting from horseback, and are often found charging across a battlefield, with the symbol of their order trailing on a long, fluttering banner. The cavalier's true power comes from the conviction of his ideals, the oaths that he swears, and the challenges he makes.
